summary: This document contains due diligence research results related to Neptune, LLC, including searches for negative media and court cases associated with the entity. It highlights connections to Jeffrey Epstein, particularly regarding campaign contributions to New Mexico gubernatorial candidate Gary King from businesses linked to Epstein's address in the U.S. Virgin Islands. The document also discusses the implications of these findings for compliance and legal review. This document discusses the legal proceedings in the case of Neary v. Burns, focusing on the claims made by plaintiffs Neary and Benevento against Burns and 2784 LLC regarding the wrongful withholding of funds from the sale of a property. The court addresses various defenses raised by Burns, including issues of standing and the necessity of joining other members of the LLC in the lawsuit. This document discusses the case of Neary v. Burns, where Burns is accused of wrongfully withholding distributions from the sale of property owned by 2784 LLC. The court examines Burns' actions and the claims made by the plaintiffs regarding fiduciary duties and indemnification requests. This document appears to be a comprehensive business report detailing various entities associated with the name 'Neptune' across multiple locations in Florida and other states. It includes addresses, roles, and some financial information related to these entities. The report also highlights potential business associates and provides insights into their operational status. This document outlines a legal case involving plaintiffs Thomas J. Neary and Salvatore Benevento against defendants 2784 West 15th Street, LLC and Arthur Burns. The case revolves around allegations of wrongful withholding of distributions from the sale of real property owned by the LLC, with discussions of standing, fiduciary duties, and the management of the LLCs involved. This document discusses a legal dispute involving Burns, the manager of 2784 LLC, and plaintiffs Neary and Benevento regarding the alleged wrongful withholding of distributions from the sale of a property. The plaintiffs assert that Burns breached his fiduciary duties by not distributing funds owed to them, leading to multiple causes of action against him and the LLC. The court addresses motions related to standing and the sufficiency of the plaintiffs' claims. This document discusses a civil suit involving 2784 LLC and Neptune LLC, focusing on a loan agreement and allegations of wrongful withholding of distributions by Burns. The document outlines the claims made by the plaintiffs against Burns regarding his management of the LLCs and his request for indemnification. It concludes with the denial of Burns' motion for indemnification and reimbursement.

events.title: Campaign Contributions Linked to Epstein
events.description: An article reported that Gary King received campaign contributions from businesses linked to Epstein's address.

events.title: Return of Campaign Contributions
events.description: Following Epstein's arrest, several politicians, including Bill Richardson, returned campaign contributions linked to him.

events.title: Sale of 2784 premises
events.description: 2784 LLC sold the 2784 premises to M & A Realty Services, LLC for $1,050,000.

events.title: Filing of action
events.description: Plaintiffs filed the action against Burns and 2784 LLC regarding the withholding of funds.

events.title: Stipulation of Discontinuance
events.description: Plaintiffs discontinued the action against the McRory defendants.

events.title: Burns' motion to dismiss
events.description: Burns filed a motion to dismiss the plaintiffs' amended verified complaint.

events.title: Letter from Burns
events.description: Burns sent a letter detailing the deductions made from the plaintiffs' distributions.

events.title: Court Decision
events.description: The court denied Burns' motion regarding indemnification and reimbursement for legal fees.

events.title: Formation of LLCs
events.description: The operating agreements for 2784 LLC and Neptune LLC were executed by the initial members.

events.title: Vote to Sell Neptune Avenue Premises
events.description: Members of Neptune LLC voted on a proposal to sell the Neptune Avenue premises, with a majority in favor.

events.title: Court Decision on Eviction
events.description: Justice Mark I. Partnow denied a motion by Neptune LLC to require Neary and Benevento to vacate their apartments.

events.title: Filing of Current Action
events.description: Plaintiffs filed the current action against 2784 LLC and Arthur Burns.

events.title: Death of Grace
events.description: Grace, Burns' mother and a member of 2784 LLC, died at the age of 99.

events.title: Motion for Default Judgment
events.description: Plaintiffs moved for a default judgment against 2784 LLC.

events.title: Court Hearing
events.description: The court held oral arguments regarding the plaintiffs' motion to amend their complaint.

events.title: Letter from Bums
events.description: Bums sent a letter detailing deductions from distributions to certain members based on their rent-stabilized tenancies.

events.title: Distribution of Sale Proceeds
events.description: Distributions from the sale of the 2784 premises were issued by 2784 LLC.

events.title: Civil Suit Filing
events.description: A civil suit was filed in New Jersey Superior Court involving Neptune LLC.

keyFacts: Neptune, LLC was involved in due diligence research that revealed negative media results linked to Jeffrey Epstein.
Gary King received over $35,000 in campaign contributions from an address associated with Epstein.
Epstein was convicted in 2008 for soliciting sex from minors and is listed as a sex offender.
Bill Richardson and other politicians returned campaign contributions linked to Epstein after his arrest.
The document highlights the need for compliance review due to the negative media results.
Burns is accused of improperly withholding over $80,000 in distributions from the sale of the 2784 premises.
Neary and Benevento are members of 2784 LLC and claim they are entitled to their respective shares of the sale proceeds.
The court has acknowledged Neary's membership in 2784 LLC and Benevento's beneficial interest through the Estate of Julia.
Burns has previously recognized Neary and Benevento as members of 2784 LLC.
The action involves claims of breach of fiduciary duty and improper financial management by Burns.
Burns is accused of wrongfully withholding distributions from the sale of property owned by 2784 LLC.
The plaintiffs allege that Burns deducted amounts from their distributions due to their rent-stabilized tenancies.
Burns claims he acted within the bounds of the Operating Agreement and seeks indemnification for legal fees.
The court found that questions of fact exist regarding Burns' alleged bad faith and breach of fiduciary duties.
The court denied Burns' motion for indemnification as premature.
The document lists numerous entities with the name 'Neptune' across various counties in Florida and other states.
Addresses for these entities include locations in Miami, Key West, and Naples, among others.
The report indicates that there are multiple business associates connected to these entities.
There are references to various corporate filings and UCC filings associated with the listed entities.
The document contains a disclaimer about the accuracy of the public records and commercially available data sources.
The document discusses a legal case involving wrongful withholding of distributions from LLCs.
Thomas J. Neary and Salvatore Benevento are plaintiffs alleging misconduct by Arthur Burns.
The LLCs were formed to manage properties inherited from deceased family members.
The court ruled that Neptune LLC could not evict tenants with rent-stabilized leases.
There are allegations of bad faith and misconduct against the manager of the LLCs.
Burns is accused of withholding over $80,000 in distributions from the sale of the 2784 premises.
Neary and Benevento are both members of 2784 LLC and claim wrongful withholding of their respective shares.
Grace, Burns' mother, was a member of 2784 LLC and passed away in 2012.
Julia was a member of 2784 LLC, and Benevento claims a beneficial interest through her estate.
The court granted plaintiffs' motion to amend their complaint to focus on direct claims against Burns and 2784 LLC.
Bums is accused of wrongfully withholding distributions from members of the LLCs.
The plaintiffs allege that Bums deducted amounts from their distributions due to their rent-stabilized tenancies.
The document discusses a loan of $250,000 from 2784 LLC to Neptune LLC, which is not challenged by the plaintiffs.
Bums seeks indemnification for legal expenses related to the litigation.
A letter from Bums dated March 9, 2010, establishes the basis for the plaintiffs' claims.
